Description: Doll; bone; with legs and arms clearly delineated; one arm missing; the ears are pierced and have incomplete earrings attached.
Curator's comments: On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314, esp. 310.
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
